text: [Music]
I'm Victor Quinn director of engineering
here at spring spring is like having a
shopping mall in your pocket
last year Black Friday we had a bit of a
mess on our hands we actually received
such a high volume of emails and coming
to our address wasn't able to keep up
and started rejecting the emails that
were sent to spring from the brands so
the quick stopgap solution we found was
to register multiple email councils that
the brands could send us not just to one
address but to multiple to help spread
the load out because our customer
support team didn't necessarily know
which of the inbox is that the emails
were coming to they often had 50 tabs
open in their browser and would jump
back and forth between them all trying
to search for particular emails about a
particular customers tracking
information and so it was ridiculously
onerous for them to find an email that
was relevant so when we sat down to
figure out how we would solve the
problem we looked at a bunch of
different email providers that could
accept large amounts of incoming email
that dealt with the volume that we were
dealing with and when as we looked at
that landscape we looked at different
solutions and the one that really popped
out to us was AWS so once we settled on
Amazon as the solution here using their
simple email service it's very easy to
fire off all sorts of other things to
happen downstream after we receive that
email so in response to receiving an
email we can queue messages that go into
queues we can have workers that pick up
the emails and process them
appropriately it made our whole system a
lot simpler instead of the state that we
had before so this black ride is coming
up and I feel fantastic
I mean it's yeah I know it's one part of
our system that we don't have to be
concerned about because it can
definitely handle the volume of load
that we're going to get
you
[Music]
